website_summaries.verdict: A faithful recreation and a must-have for fans of the original Xbox.
pros: A perfect revival of the first Xbox controller feels exactly like it did in 2001, with a 9 foot long USB cable, classic black and white buttons, new left and right buttons to meet the Xbox One controller standard, and the classic Xbox startup screen plays on the controller’s Xbox button
Available in black, green, and red
cons: The Duke make be too big for players with smaller hands

customer_reviews.title: A modern classic
customer_reviews.text: I’ve played with most controllers ranging from Nintendo 64 to the Xbox one and the duke is the best design for those with large hands. The packaging was very professional and you can even place it back in the box when not using it due to the foam padding cut out inside. Build quality on this is a 10 and the wire included with the controller is long enough to work for most setups. For the price this controller is a steal!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony F.

customer_reviews.title: Cool..... for a couple months
customer_reviews.text: Nothing too bad, but be forewarned, this wired controller doesn't last. I read the reviews mentioning the same issues and thought, meh..... It was a waste of $50. The wired portion slowly deformed at the top of the controller not allowing the wire itself to properly seat, therefore due to the light weight to the wire it causes the controller to lose power because it's not making the proper metal-on-metal connection. I got caught in the nostalgia aspect, but it's a cheap product. I'd return if I could.....
customer_reviews.author: Devin M.

customer_reviews.title: Great controller, very well built.
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing a lot, it feels great love the green color. The controller itself took some getting used to but now I prefer it over others.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrid

customer_reviews.title: It's FRAGILE.
customer_reviews.text: The controller is GREAT for gamers with Large Hands. The problem with this controller, is that it is very FRAGILE. My Left Trigger [LT] started shorting out after just 2 months, and I take great care of my belongings. Do NOT purchase this controller unless you intend on buying another one a few months later.
customer_reviews.author: DSW

customer_reviews.title: Best xb1 controller
customer_reviews.text: Fu/cking amazing. Favorite controller. There is a rather large adjustment period if you are trained on stick X1 controllers. But you get used to it quick and the Xbox startup screen is dope
customer_reviews.author: Jallegree

customer_reviews.title: Awesome throwback
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new controller for my Xbox and I am tired of the current design, so I saw this one and decided to take a chance. I've used it for a good while now and I have to say that this controller is great. I like the fact that it is large and comfortable. The thumb sticks are very smooth and precise. Kinda a bummer that it's wired but it's something I can work with.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Works great for big hands but wearing fast!
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my big hands. I used it for at least 100 hours of gameplay and the left joystick is wearing a bit. I have to purposely adjust the stick orientation a little to the right to move straight which is annoying and can feel a little roughness through the stick. I suspect I will have to repair it soon. But other than that I’ve enjoyed gaming with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite controller now! EPIC!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Arrived new and working! It looks just like the Xbox Halo Edition and feels just like the OG controller! It is sort of heavy making it feel durable! It has this cool animation taken straight from the old Xbox startup scree that plays on the controller every time you press the Xbox button! The rumble is good, the thumbsticks are good, and it feels great for someone with larger hands. People with small hands could have a difficult time using it, though. This is just die to the size of the original controller that this matches so perfectly! Disclaimer: it's not wireless but it's still great! Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: TriVoxel

customer_reviews.title: (Xbox Startup Noises)
customer_reviews.text: While I definitely do not have the muscle memory to use it to it's full potential yet (grew up on Playstation), I love the time I spent using it. I cannot wait to use it more and it is way too satisfying to push the Xbox button and watch the animation play over and over. The buttons feel good, and it is very sturdy. I would definitely recommend this controller in any or all colors if you are a fan of Xbox. Also, the cable the Duke controller comes with is also compatible with any Xbox One controllers, so it's a win win!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great old school feel for OG Xbox players
customer_reviews.text: Great controller for people like me with awkwardly big hands. The bumpers are a little hard to hit, so I just use the white and black buttons instead. I've also gotten used to the placement and shape of the buttons on the smaller Xbox controllers that were standard design since the original version, so I slip up on hitting the A,B,X,Y buttons here and there. But it's been coming back the more I play with it. Overall, I enjoy using it. I also liked the Sega Saturn 3D controller, and even the Dreamcast (big hands again haha)
customer_reviews.author: Stewart Craig

customer_reviews.title: Duke
customer_reviews.text: Go big or go home. Uh , found it to be compatible with my hands . Was familiar with the controller from the original system. Liked the power button must buy from a chilled gamer, but must say it's big and probably an array of consumers will be wobbling it there hands for the right grip because of it's girth .
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Still the best, without a doubt my favorite.
customer_reviews.text: People like to laugh at how massive this controller is but honestly it’s so much more comfortable to my not at all large hands. New bumpers fit the newer grip most people use, or if you’re using “claw” grip the black and white buttons are comfortably close to everything. I think the Duke is the best controller on the market, I just wish we could get a wireless version.
customer_reviews.author: Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Feels like the original but reacts faster
customer_reviews.text: I was completely blown away by this remake/remastered Original Xbox controller. The green color takes me back to the early 2000s while the center button being a tiny screen makes this thing seem like a controller from the future. The bumper buttons are added while the Black and White buttons work great, once I remembered they were there.
customer_reviews.author: PaddyWagon

customer_reviews.title: Finally a controller for my huge hands
customer_reviews.text: So I've always had pretty big hands. Most controllers have been ok to use but always felt a bit smaller than I would like. This is probably the most comfortable controller I've ever owned. Fits perfectly in my hands and is very high quality. Also has an awesome screen in the middle of it that will give you serious nostalgia with the simple press of a button. Definitely worth it
customer_reviews.author: Alfred

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgia, sweet sweet nostalgia
customer_reviews.text: I was too young to get an Xbox with the duke, but I did hear stories of them. The controller is not half bad. I played a lot of BF5 and got use to the feel. If you want to change up you grip, the controller is a great addition to your arsenal.
customer_reviews.author: Krassodo

customer_reviews.title: Blast from the past!
customer_reviews.text: A durable large controller. I love this thing. Somehow it makes certain games easier for me to play and i just enjoy the nostalgia trip it gives me. The lvd screen in the center is pretty cool too.
customer_reviews.author: Lavi

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable Nostalgia
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic controller stays as true as possible to the original duke. The controller feels as though it was built to play Halo as that was the first game I played with it it has bumpers on it which surprisingly aren't that difficult to use considering the distance between the triggers and bumpers. The entire original xbox startup screen plays on the lcd screen that it has on it and it replays every time you press the home button very cool little feature that hyperkin added.
customer_reviews.author: Jakob chapman

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Everything I expected. I needed a controller for my PC and this one works and feels exactly how the old Xbox controller used to feel. There is rumble feature, it uses a usb connection, the materials used to make the controller is nice and the center has a neat looking splash screen of the original Xbox console logo when you plug it in. I normally don't recommend many products but I definitely recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgia product.
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job reminding you of the original Xbox days. It's fun playing Halo and Forza with this. Controller is built well and feels nice. True to the original. Rumble feels great. Thumbsticks are perfect. The one con is the bumper placement. It is horrible. They are extremely uncomfortable and inconvenient to use. This is coming from somebody with huge hands. A better alternative would have been putting them on the back of the controller.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Good for nostalgia but not for an avid gamer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this awhile ago. When I first got it it was amazing. I was playing Halo 5 and Halo Wars 2 on it and it felt better than the regular Xbox One controller. Unfortunately after a month or so it woukd start drifting mid game or while I was engaging another player. I didn't return it because its a nice display piece but unfortunately I won't be buying this again for my gaming needs.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua

customer_reviews.title: Great for OG Xbox guys and gals
customer_reviews.text: I love this controller. Feels old school and yet very nice in hand. New buttons are nice and works very well. I don't feel like I'm going to break it everytime I'm gaming hard. Only wish it was wireless but still awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: Great controller for oldschoolers
customer_reviews.text: Omg I lol love my duke controller. So many find memories. I have small hands but regular controllers hurt to play with my sore hands. Took getting used to button locations but I don't want to go back. Amazing value I love it and had it for a few months and do my best to take care of it. No problems
customer_reviews.author: animallover377

customer_reviews.title: Simple Childish Review
customer_reviews.text: It's THE DUKE,,,, It's A Number One! (if you are old enough to know this quote, god bless you) For the rest of you. Look up Kurt Russell in 1981.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: Massive hardware issues
customer_reviews.text: I've had the controller for almost a year now, it's seen light use. The analog sticks are broken. Up and down inputs on the left stick are also causing left and right movements on the right stick, rendering the controller unusable. An absolute shame, I loved the original Duke, and this one felt just like it, but my nostalgia was played for coin.
customer_reviews.author: Avery Miller

customer_reviews.title: Bumper buttons are total garbage
customer_reviews.text: The bumper buttons were added as an afterthought, and are totally unusable. If it wasnt for the bumper buttons being useless because of size and location, Id have given it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mski

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgia at its finest
customer_reviews.text: Great for those who grew up playing the original Xbox. Just don't expect to comfortably play modern shooters on this controller. Also it is friggin huge
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: I always liked the Duke.
customer_reviews.text: So after a bit of time owning this controller the left and right stick buttons have become extremely hard to get to register when pushed down. All of the other buttons still work but it is annoying when you are used to using the sticks for melee or crouching. I have never had those go out on another controller, usually it is drift that makes me get a new controller.
customer_reviews.author: DudeWhat

customer_reviews.title: great controller for big hands
customer_reviews.text: Perfect controller for people with big hands and a great remake of the original. Love the display screen.
customer_reviews.author: Meanbone79

customer_reviews.title: you hit me right in the nostalgia
customer_reviews.text: Feels just like the original Xbox controller. The bumpers are super easy to use and I thought the screen with the original Xbox load up screen was really cool. Currently my favorite controller.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: great nostalgia piece, and a generally great working controller.
customer_reviews.text: If your a fan of the original Xbox and classic game systems, or just want to relive your Halo party glory days, this is the controller for you. It is a great working controller, smooth stick operation and added bumper buttons for the white and black buttons.
customer_reviews.author: William Wyrick

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Right trigger made loud sounds from the moment I began using it. Very annoying my wife said it definitely wasn’t worth the money for it to have that defect.
customer_reviews.author: BusyMomOf3

customer_reviews.title: weak cable. Should have gone usb c.
customer_reviews.text: ugh I love this thing but only a few weeks after buying it the cord snapped. Getting a replacement seems impossible wo I haven't used it at all. It was awesome while it lasted, but be gentle with that ity bity micro USB cord. Also the triggers were super squeaky.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Schotten

customer_reviews.title: thumbstick issue
customer_reviews.text: great in the beginning, after a few uses, the thumbstick started drifting to one side and leaves me unable to play video games now!!
customer_reviews.author: Arielle Love

customer_reviews.title: Best Controller in The World 5 Star
customer_reviews.text: It is the best controller I have ever had in my life. It is so thick and strong and high quality. The buttons and joysticks feel amazing. I had to buy another one to just have or give as a gift to someone. Buy this Controller it is ment for the OG Xbox Owners and big people. Me 6'4 310lbs+. It is seriously amazing. The screen is so high resolution. Everything A++++++!!!!!! 5/5 **** $T@R'$
customer_reviews.author: Ripped Off Never Again Angry Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it....
customer_reviews.text: Love it..... only complaint is the missed opportunity of mapping white/black buttons to something else. Would recommend for large hand gamers
customer_reviews.author: kent

customer_reviews.title: I have big hands, I thought this would meet the needs, but the design is not good
customer_reviews.text: I have big hands, I thought this would meet the needs, but the design is not good The bumpers and the triggers are so far apart that if you're using both in a game you have to shift your hands. The size is nice, but the design shows why this guy was retired.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Bring me good memory.
customer_reviews.text: Very old school classic controller just like the original xbox and it does work very well love it.
customer_reviews.author: Gol_Sonaak

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, broke down easily.
customer_reviews.text: Buttons and controls very cheap, not even close to being worth what it cost. In less than a month had to buy my son another controller. If I could give it 0 stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: Nadine64

customer_reviews.title: Good controller, bad cable.
customer_reviews.text: Best controller I've ever owned BUT!!! The cable shorted out within 3 days and nearly set my chair on fire. I would give 5 stars, if it wasn't trying to kill me.
customer_reviews.author: Cpt_Corde

customer_reviews.title: Grab yourself some nostalgia
customer_reviews.text: My second one after buying the black Duke...great controller just wish Microsoft would have allowed Hyperkin to make them wireless
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Parkinson

customer_reviews.title: The best controller ever
customer_reviews.text: I personally love The Duke. I have large hands so it's more comfortable for me to use. Plus the power button plays the original Xbox load screen. Really cool feature. I would definitely buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: tom martin

customer_reviews.title: Don’t bother, get a real controller.
customer_reviews.text: why isn’t the damn cord part of the thing. The fact that it’s separate, as well as that the slot it hooks into is very flimsy, makes this controller worthless for anything other than collecting dust.
customer_reviews.author: Mitchel Warnke

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I ordered
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly. Exactly what I ordered. My 13 year old loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Thomason

customer_reviews.title: met all my expectations and then some
customer_reviews.text: a fun novelty toy i use each and every day. took a little getting use to, but now I cant see myself using any other controller (other than a different color variant)
customer_reviews.author: Moses Ellingsworth

customer_reviews.title: Such A Throwback
customer_reviews.text: It's a cool nostalgic controller to own. Unless you play a game with very little button play it's just for looks in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Heitz

customer_reviews.title: Read before buying
customer_reviews.text: I've bought two of them and they both came broken. Looks good but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: corey_grimm

customer_reviews.title: Controller came broken
customer_reviews.text: The D-Pad on the controller came broken and does not work at all
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Quintanilla

customer_reviews.title: Such a Throwback
customer_reviews.text: It feels like the early 2000s all over again. Is it the most comfortable controller? No. Is it the most functional? No. Is it nostalgic and fun to breakout for some splitscreen Halo? Yes. It operates via basic micro USB, so that's nice. They added bumpers on the shoulders which were not on the original. These are simply duplicates of the Black/White buttons. They are just a small added benefit. Every time you click the middle button, it shows the Original Xbox startup screen, which is awesome. I recommend this for sure, but only if you understand that it is not a normal sized or normal feeling controller.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Walsh

product_meta.title: Hyperkin Duke Wired Controller for Xbox One/ Windows 10 PC (Green Limited Edition) - Officially Licensed by Xbox
product_meta.description: Voted Windows Central 2018 Best Gaming Controller of the Year! Hyperkin has recreated the original Xbox controller aka "Duke" as an officially Xbox-licensed controller, compatible with the Xbox One family of devices and Windows 10 PCs. The Hyperkin Duke for Xbox One - Wired Controller features the original Xbox startup screen animated inside the Xbox Button, precision analog triggers, bumpers, a 3.5 mm headset jack, a 9 ft. detachable USB cable, and the return of the Black (RB) and White (LB) buttons. The Hyperkin Duke is big, buff,and ready for action.
feature_bullets: Classic design featuring the original Xbox animated startup screen played right inside the Xbox Button
Vibration feedback for realistic experiences; Precision analog triggers and bumpers that mirror the Black and White buttons
Classic X, B, A, Y, LT, RT, Black (RB), and White (LB) button layout (including Option and View buttons)
3.5 mm headset jack; 9 ft. detachable USB cable (required to use controller)
Original Xbox-style controller for Xbox One and Windows 10 PCs

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars255 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
